metadata.title: CVE-2023-2700 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in libvirt. This security flaw ouccers due torepeatedly querying an SR-IOV PCI device's capabilities that exposes amemory leak caused by a failure to free the virPCIVirtualFunction arraywithin the parent struct's g_autoptr cleanup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-clients - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-clients-qemu - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-config-network - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-system - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-l10n - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-login-shell - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-sanlock - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt-wireshark - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
libvirt0 - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.0.0-2ubuntu1.1').
